comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

Steps:
1. Start composing a new mail
2. Enter some text: asdf
3. Select style: Heading 2
4. Press enter


Actual results:

Composer puts two newline characters


Expected results:

Only 1 newline character should have been added

comments.text:
Brain is this a regression ?

Do you see this when you start Thunderbird in -safe-mode (http://support.mozillamessaging.com/en-US/kb/Safe-Mode) ?
comments.raw_text:
Brain is this a regression ?

Do you see this when you start Thunderbird in -safe-mode (http://support.mozillamessaging.com/en-US/kb/Safe-Mode) ?

comments.creator: akos.brain@gmail.com
comments.author: akos.brain@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Yes I can reproduce it in safe mode (without addons, and all toolbars reseted) as well.
comments.text: Yes I can reproduce it in safe mode (without addons, and all toolbars reseted) as well.

comments.author: jporterbugs@gmail.com
comments.creator: jporterbugs@gmail.com
comments.text: I think this is how headings are supposed to work. They're HTML heading tags (<h1> and friends) and those have a bottom margin (padding?) of 1em.
comments.raw_text: I think this is how headings are supposed to work. They're HTML heading tags (<h1> and friends) and those have a bottom margin (padding?) of 1em.

comments.text: I don't think this is how they supposed to work. I can delete the additional newline with a backspace and it still keeps the format.
comments.raw_text: I don't think this is how they supposed to work. I can delete the additional newline with a backspace and it still keeps the format.
